title: Auto-scroll Task Hub log view to latest line
description:
Improve Task Hub log UX: when a task is actively streaming logs, keep the log view scrolled to the newest line.

Context: Task Hub currently appends labels into an ExpanderRow, and the overall popover is inside a ScrolledWindow.

Work:
- Track/obtain the relevant GtkAdjustment (vadjustment) and scroll to bottom when AppendTaskLog arrives.
- Avoid stealing scroll position when user manually scrolls up (optional but preferred).
acceptance_criteria: With log streaming active, new log lines remain visible without manual scrolling.

title: Add log streaming support for non-APT backends
description:
Extend real-time Task Hub log streaming beyond APT.

Context: We already have src/backend/streaming.rs (run_streaming + ANSI stripping) and src/backend/traits.rs provides *_streaming fallbacks. Only AptBackend implements streaming today.

Work:
- Implement install_streaming/remove_streaming/update_streaming for other backends where feasible (Flatpak, Snap, Dnf, etc.).
- Use run_streaming for non-privileged commands; use run_pkexec_with_logs when pkexec is required.
- Update UI glue so operations use *_streaming for all sources (not Apt-only), and Task Hub receives AppendTaskLog events.
acceptance_criteria: Running install/remove/update for non-APT sources shows live logs in Task Hub without blocking UI.

title: Refactor relm_app streaming wiring into helper
description:
Reduce duplication in src/ui/relm_app.rs for log streaming setup.

Context: Install/Remove/Update for Apt currently each create a tokio mpsc channel and spawn a relay task that maps StreamLine -> AppMsg::AppendLog.

Work:
- Extract this pattern into a helper (e.g. spawn_log_relay(task_id, sender) -> mpsc::Sender<StreamLine>).
- Prefer a single implementation used by install/remove/update (and later bulk ops).
acceptance_criteria: relm_app streaming wiring has no copy/paste blocks; behavior unchanged.
